required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing the Impact of Acupuncture Therapy on Medical Resident Well-Being: Feasibility and Acceptance
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing the Impact of Acupuncture Therapy on Medical Resident Well-Being: Feasibility and Acceptance

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: This feasibility study develops methods for larger-scale research, evaluating the acceptability and perceived impact of a group acupuncture and acupressure intervention, as well as suitability of a self-report instrument. During their weekly training program, eleven OB residents at NYU Lutheran Medical Center will receive three sessions of auricular acupuncture therapy. (This resident population was previously anonymously surveyed and all expressed interest in participating in such a study). The Professional Quality of Life Scale (ProQOL) will be administered at 6 time points. A brief survey will also be given to assess participants' acceptance of the intervention as well as applicability of the ProQOL instrument. Additional feasibility-related outcomes include protocol compliance/withdrawals, adverse events, and time taken to complete intervention and surveys.

primary_outcome.description: he ProQOL is the most commonly used measure of the negative and positive affects of helping others who experience suffering and trauma. The ProQOL has sub-scales for compassion satisfaction, burnout and compassion fatigue.

arm_group.description: The intervention will be three sessions of auricular acupuncture therapy; there will be no control intervention.

intervention.description: Acupuncture treatment will be the NADA protocol, a well-known and commonly used protocol that has previously been studied for stress relief in health care workers.In this protocol, 5, Â½" needles are inserted in each auricle and retained while the group relaxes for 20 minutes. It will be conducted by two acupuncturists credentialed at NYU Lutheran (TK and AG).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Enrollment in NYU Lutheran Obstetrics & Gynecology Residency program
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women currently pregnant or attempting to conceive

overall_official.affiliation: New York University School of Medicine

facility.name: New York University School of Medicine
